subject: Re: [junit] Setting up an in-memory database?
msgSnippet: ... I ve come up with another solution... Two test decorators, the first of which just sets up an in-process, in-memory HSQLDB database. The second, derived
messageBody:
On Tuesday 22 February 2005 00:05, Jeff Nielsen wrote:

> See http://www.digitalfocus.com/JeffsJava/AntSqlExec.html for the
> code we use to execute DDL statements from our DB-dependent JUnit
> tests. You can write the statements right into the test or read them
> from a file, just like the ant <sql> task.

I've come up with another solution... Two test decorators, the first of
which just sets up an in-process, in-memory HSQLDB database. The
second, derived one reads and executes script files. The latter stuff
is pretty basic, following org.hsqldb.util.ScriptTool in simply passing
the entire contents of each script file to Statement#execute(String).

See
<http://www.schuerig.de/michael/java/msutils/xref/de/schuerig/testing/HsqlTestSetup.html>
<http://www.schuerig.de/michael/java/msutils/xref/de/schuerig/testing/HsqlScriptTestSetup.html>
